Program text

SOUND

The Paris-based singer and producer Yasmine Dubois grew up in Tehran and lived in New York; her musical career began in a Mexican punk band. Her first EP Tan from 2016 already featured sharp-edged rhythmic globalisation pop. On her debut album, due for release this spring, she has refined and differentiated her style even more. LAFAWNDAH combines syncopated rânâb beats with tribal analogue drums, mind-bending hurdy gurdy loops, and exquisite lascivious vocals.
